dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
Caliper is a program instrumentation and performance measurement
framework. It is designed as a performance analysis toolbox in a
library, allowing one to bake performance analysis capabilities directly
into applications and activate them at runtime.
dependencies.name: caliper

dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.
dependencies.name: cmake

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
API for dynamic binary instrumentation. Modify programs while they are
executing without recompiling, re-linking, or re-executing.
dependencies.name: dyninst

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: fortran

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.
dependencies.name: hip

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description:
A portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the
call-chain of a program.
dependencies.name: libunwind

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description: IBM MPI implementation from Spectrum MPI.
dependencies.name: mpi

dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.
dependencies.name: ninja

dependencies.description:
PAPI provides the tool designer and application engineer with a
consistent interface and methodology for use of the performance counter
hardware found in most major microprocessors. PAPI enables software
engineers to see, in near real time, the relation between software
performance and processor events. In addition Component PAPI provides
access to a collection of components that expose performance measurement
opportunities across the hardware and software stack.
dependencies.name: papi

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
It is a C library for Linux that provides a user space interface for
applications to monitor and control GPU applications.
dependencies.name: rocm-smi-lib

dependencies.description: ROCPROFILER library for AMD HSA runtime API extension support
dependencies.name: rocprofiler-dev

dependencies.description:
ROCProfiler-SDK is AMD’s new and improved tooling infrastructure,
providing a hardware-specific low-level performance analysis interface
for profiling and tracing GPU compute applications.
dependencies.name: rocprofiler-sdk

dependencies.description:
ROC-tracer library: Runtimes Generic Callback/Activity APIs. The goal of
the implementation is to provide a generic independent from specific
runtime profiler to trace API and asyncronous activity.
dependencies.name: roctracer-dev

dependencies.description:
A portable profiling and tracing toolkit for performance analysis of
parallel programs written in Fortran, C, C++, UPC, Java, Python.
dependencies.name: tau

dependencies.description:
Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project. It was
invented by Richard Stallman and Bob Chassell many years ago, loosely
based on Brian Reid's Scribe and other formatting languages of the time.
It is used by many non-GNU projects as well.
dependencies.name: texinfo

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Enable support for using Caliper markers in omnitrace instrumentation
variants.name: caliper

variants.description: the build system generator to use
variants.name: generator

variants.description: Enable intercepting MPI functions and aggregating output during finalization (requires target application to use same MPI installation)
variants.name: mpi

variants.description: Enable intercepting MPI functions but w/o support for aggregating output (target application can use any MPI installation)
variants.name: mpi_headers

variants.description: Enable HW counters support via PAPI
variants.name: papi

variants.description: Enable support for Python function profiling and API
variants.name: python

variants.description: Enable ROCm API, kernel tracing, and GPU HW counters support
variants.name: rocm

variants.description: Enable support for using TAU markers in omnitrace instrumentation
variants.name: tau
